definitions.definition: An interception of a radio broadcast or a telephone call.
The coordinate of the point at which a curve intersects an axis.
A form of market research where consumers are intercepted and interviewed in a retail store or mall.
To stop, deflect or divert (something in progress or motion).
definitions.example: The police intercepted the package of stolen goods while it was in transit.

definitions.definition: To gain possession of (the ball) in a ball game
